alert.note: Alert for Hamilton (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 6:06PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Hamilton County through 745 PM EDT... At 705 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lookout Mountain, or 9 miles northeast of Trenton, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Signal Mountain, Ridgeside, Red Bank, East Ridge and Lookout Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
